TopicTitle: (0.23) Wayland Corp. Development and released download Thread (new parts)

Articles.Content:
Try uploading your file as a private file, then editing it to be public. It was the only way my upload showed up.

Thanks! I'll give it a shot.

All mods I update and upload are OK, it's just the new ones and I have literally about 8 to add.. some I havent even posted screenshots here of.
Oh, I'm so jumping that off the launch ramp.

Enjoy

Spaceport Sucks I give up on it.

I will be starting a dedicated Kerbal Modding website very soon

If you need a mirror for the files when you get going, give me a yell, I have my own servers here at home with a reasonable connection

.

Jeb officially approves this mod.
Is this mod maker on the Dev team? If he isn't they should really consider him...

Is this mod maker on the Dev team? If he isn't they should really consider him...

No.

Speaking of Dev teams, Bobcat should be on the dev team too.

No.

Speaking of Dev teams, Bobcat should be on the dev team too.

They should pick Bobcat well before me, he is like the Master, I am simply the grasshopper I am amazed they have not already snapped him up, Bac9 is a great texture artist, but as a modeller and a mod maker, I would put Bobcat on top for sure.

@Tommygun LOL.. I really need to give the texture on the under carriage some attention.. especially the way you drive <chuckle>

I have another goodie.. while I am waiting for said plugins to be fixed, I decided I will try and release 1 thing per day, just to clear out this mass of parts and odd junk I've made.

I started up on some stock parts, I figured I should give some a go. This cargo bay was a first attempt at trying to get the size right, and it just happened to fit the

new Clamp O Tron SR first go, so here it is.. nothing special, just an alternative to the other cargo bays, suited for 2.5 meter of course.

The CB-1 Cargo Bay (Stock style Addon)

Download Link

======================================

These are the wheels coming for the proper Freelancer Rover release:

(Wheels download, coming soon )

Edited May 27, 2013 by Devo

These are the wheels coming for the proper Freelancer Rover release:

-snip-

(Wheels download, coming soon )

Sweeeeeet!

Might release the APC wheels soon. They are not good for this sort of buggy tho, they were designed to have very little turn in the steering, the APC was not built for maneuvering, whereas the FL-1 was built, as Tommygun demonstrated, for pure unadulterated kerbal fun.
Devo you amaze me. But maybe they have asked bobcat, but he turned it down so he could still focus on all his mods he spends his time on.
BAH, the wait is killing me, me needs a strong and sturdy wheel fast!

Four wheels good, twelve wheels better

Loving these mods, great work man.

I love the look of the FL-1, Devo. Have you ever thought of making an ODST drop pod with the Chute at all? After the Cockpit you just released, I think you'd do a fantastic job making a replica of the ODST drop pod
There already is one somewhere on the web, I had it back in .18.2
I guess I'll have to go check for that. Regardless, I think Devo would do great with it
Wheels? :3

Ok well after 4 attempts and alot of frigging around, I can upload to the spaceport again..

Fixed the rover body up, added some battle scarring, will fix as time goes on

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/0-20-freelancer-rover-body-mk1-wayland-corp/

Cool it's pre-broken in.

I forgot to mention this before, the GUI names are reversed in the original FL-1 release.

Open closes the doors and Close opens them, I haven't had a chance to check the new version yet.

I just wanted to say that I enjoy using your mods.

I read that you hated doing internals and currently wished there was a decent tutorial that I could follow to create one for the freelancer. Until then I did a quick hack using Bobcat's DEMV MK5 Ant just so I could see the IVA instead of the cupola. I still need to remove the floating controls from the config but you get the idea.

I just wanted to say that I enjoy using your mods.

I read that you hated doing internals and currently wished there was a decent tutorial that I could follow to create one for the freelancer. Until then I did a quick hack using Bobcat's DEMV MK5 Ant just so I could see the IVA instead of the cupola. I still need to remove the floating controls from the config but you get the idea.

Aha thank you!! I had been through a few IVA to find one to suit, but I think you found it there! I don't even mind with the floating controls, sort of looks like a HUD The whole point was a very large viewing area for manual flying from the cockpit.

@Tommy thanks, yeah I need to fix that

Aha thank you!! I had been through a few IVA to find one to suit, but I think you found it there! I don't even mind with the floating controls, sort of looks like a HUD The whole point was a very large viewing area for manual flying from the cockpit.

@Tommy thanks, yeah I need to fix that

You're welcome. It's quite a bit up front but If I could learn how to do IVA's (I _WISH_ there was a decent updated tutorial) I would give it a try and make one that is pushed back some so you could see your control panel (where I then could probably float some controls on top of it).

Four wheels good, twelve wheels better

Loving these mods, great work man.

Larst pic were can i get those tanks?
They're from the Tri-Hex struts mod, he's expanded it to include Octo-Struts, the latest .20 complaint version is the most complete in that regard....

I should have released the 50 hex struts I made, I never put them out as I thought they wouldn't be popular, everyone wanted everything "Round"

Ah well, guess Ill pack them up and upload them, why not

I should have released the 50 hex struts I made, I never put them out as I thought they wouldn't be popular, everyone wanted everything "Round"

Ah well, guess Ill pack them up and upload them, why not

YES please - judging by what I been reading in the other threads this type of mod is very popular now
